definition:
Let $X$ be a variety. $X$ is said to be [*normal*]{} at a point $p\in X$
if the local ring ${\mathcal{O}}_p$ is integrally closed. $X$ is said to
be [*normal*]{} if it is normal at every point. If $X$ is non-singular
at $p$, it is normal at $p$, since regular local rings are integrally
closed.
